oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Stair and hall of Cragfont
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interior view of the stair and hall of Cragfont. The open-well, open-string, half-turn staircase leads to the second-floor landing. The staircase has a molded handrail, original painted risers, square balusters, a spiral handrail on the first floor, and ornamental stringer brackets. The walls have wainscot panels on the lower half. The hall has furniture, rugs, and other decor in it. Two rooms, that have doorways with shouldered architrave trim, are visible.

The late Georgian style home was built between 1798 and 1802, and was originally home of General James Winchester. It was named after the Rocky Bluff it is located on. Cragfont was occupied by the Winchester family until 1864.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Boucher, Jack E.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Dwellings--Tennessee; Architecture, Domestic--Tennessee
Stairways; Passageways; Architraves; Stairhalls; Wainscoting; Doors & doorways
